definition: to see, hear and obey (idiom); to take advice/to take sb at his word
words/speech/to say/to talk
to listen/to hear/to obey/a can (loanword from English "tin")/classifier for canned beverages
smile (archaic)
(literary pronunciation, still advocated in Taiwan) to rule/to sentence/to allow
surname Ji
to calculate/to compute/to count/to regard as important/to plan/ruse/meter/gauge
surname Cong

from/through/via/to follow/to obey/to engage in (an activity)/never (in negative sentence)/(Taiwan pr. [zong4]) retainer/assistant/auxiliary/subordinate/related by common paternal grandfather or earlier ancestor

sentences.english: The secretaries were all things to their bosses.
sentences.chinese: 秘书们对老板是言听计从。

sentences.english: My brother is an amateur photographer and a very amenable individual.
sentences.chinese: 我哥哥是名业余的摄影师，又是个言听计从的人。

sentences.english: Proponents of economic nationalism had the president's ear.
sentences.chinese: 总统对于经济民族主义的提议者则言听计从。

sentences.english: Romeo: I take thee at thy word.
Men should do what their wives tell them to do. And they should not be too careful with their money.
sentences.chinese: 丈夫应该对妻子言听计从，对钱则不要太吝啬。

sentences.english: Eg: The henpecked husband carried out everything to his wife's letter.
sentences.chinese: 这个“妻管严”的丈夫对他的妻子言听计从。

sentences.english: People do not question me , they listen and obey.
sentences.chinese: 人们从不会质疑我，他们言听计从。

definition: to follow obediently
docile and obedient/all obedience
totally submissive (idiom)
bowed head and ears glued (idiom); docile and obedient/at sb's beck and call
loyal and devoted (idiom); faithful and true
to treat sb favorably/to view in a new light
to be hell-bent on/dead set on sth/unswerving
the utmost care (idiom); to look after sb in every possible way
see 死心塌地[si3 xin1 ta1 di4]
to hold sb in the same regard as one would a god (idiom)
to call to come and shout to go (idiom); to yell orders/always bossing people around
lit. to order people by pointing the chin (idiom); to signal orders by facial gesture/arrogant and bossy
extremely (placed after verb or adjective)
deeply grateful
to honor sb as a God (idiom); to revere/to worship/to deify/to make a holy cow of sth/to put sb on a pedestal
to be a yes-man
